data: Work - Not here to be liked

Artistic black and white photo featuring a close-up of a mouth slightly open, with colored candy tablets resting on the tongue, each inscribed with a different word, in a critique or commentary on topics or personalities.

Immersive art installation at Dunham Massey, a National Trust estate near Manchester. Featuring printed matter, plants, books and a specially commissioned soundscape, the project was a collaboration with The Edible Bus Stop and Internal Garden.
We have a dossier of evidence
Visual identity and creative consulting for a campaign to hold corporate titans to account for pollution and climate crimes

Octopus Container is an immersive art installation about the dying seas, installed outside the Sainsbury Centre for Visual Arts, Norwich. The artwork was inaugurated for the Tyndall Centre’s Critical Decade for Climate Action Conference in September 2025.

Visual identity, assets, and actions for the launch of a new campaign by the Rapid Response Unit. This action is unusual in that it will be triggered by a climate crisis event, a heatwave. Planned in 2023 after the UK experienced over 40°C heat in 2022, it has not yet been triggered.

National poster campaign to announce Just Stop Oil’s next wave of actions in Autumn 2023. The skull, which was painted by an 8 year-old, became the new official symbol of Just Stop Oil. As part of the campaign someone created a giant version of our poster on Scarborough Beach.
A person is seen putting up a bright orange protest poster with the words "people vs oil" on a public wall, signaling active engagement in environmental activism.
Visual identity and event design for the first sitting of House of the People, held in London in July 2025
Campaign for Wild Card including campaign website, social media assets and a card game.
Visual identity for OurCommon.Market, a platform and movement for commoning the fashion system.
Identity and signage for independent book shop BARD BOOKS in Bow, east London.
Together with Jérôme Rigaud, we designed and developed the website for the publisher and book binding studio Book Works in London, and continue to support its development.
A computer screen displaying a website with a photo of a colorful, pie-chart style artwork next to a protest sign that reads "gaza cease fire now".
Co-design of actions and mobilisation strategy for Extinction Rebellion during its first year of existence
An activist stands on a pink boat that has a message on the side Tell The Truth in the middle of oxford circus
Banners, costumes, and concepts for fun arrestable actions including a giant smog cloud
2 lollypop ladies chase someone dressed as a smog cloud. Their sighns say stop smog.
Memes and outreach materials supporting Green New Deal Rising’s campaign to get Jamie Driscoll elected as the mayor for the North East.
Getting shit done in the North East

Campaign website to launch The Gigantic Change – a short animation featuring Whoopi Goldberg for World Environment Day in June 2020. The film was produced by Passion Pictures and Serena Schellenberg, directed by George Lewin & Nicola Jane Francis for Extinction Rebellion. Website designed with George Lewin
A computer browser window open to a website with the headline "the gigantic change" set against a stylized background featuring a misty, monochromatic forest.

Social media content produced whilst co-ordinating the social media for XR UK. We developed content pillars to communicate the campaigns key demands and strategy whilst also working reactively in response to live protest and political events as they unfolded.
A person in a blue cheerleading outfit holds a placard that says change the politics not the climate
Creative stunts to kick arms dealers out of the national gallery, and organising a week of protest to disrupt the set-up of the world’s largest arms fair.
Someone blocks a vehicle carrying weapons to the arms fair as the police try to talk to them.

A combination of screen print, stencils and hand lettering created a layered DIY look with personalised messages of rebellion. These handmade posters were the result of a collaboration with Paris 68 Redux, to promote the 2020 Rebellion in London.
Person holding a vibrant protest poster for environmental action, with bold text 'sorry not sorry' emphasizing the urgency for meeting at parliament.
Mobilisation poster campaign for the 2020 Rebellion in London.
Swearing pigeon: mass poster campaign for Extinction Rebellion UK
Colorful urban art on display under a bridge along a peaceful waterway, where street art contrasts with the tranquility of nature.
Book design and concrete poetry typography. Published by Book Works (London) in 2018.
Mutter: Design for an experimental novel by Kit Poulson
A book with a minimalistic grey cover titled "mutter" by kit poulson, featuring a graphic with eye-like symbols and a mouth-like image near the bottom, published by book works.
For Extinction Rebellion UK’s week of action in April 2022 we designed this series of hand printed double sided placards as part of the art direction of the protest.
Young activist with a poignant message, sitting at a demonstration holding a sign that states "life on earth is dying".
Visual identity for the online academic journal CEU Review of Books. Including website, social media, printed promotion and a printed magazine for the launch of the platform.
A selection of flyers created for Extinction Rebellion UK. These were handed out during protests as part of their outreach efforts.
This is an intervention: Flyers for mass mobilisation
A collage of protest and activism themes with bold text overlay saying "look up show up sit down," highlighting various forms of civil disobedience and public engagement.

Campaign website with the aim to boost the efforts of Extinction Rebellion UK and engaging people from outside the climate movement bubble to take part in the multi day mobilisation in April 2023 known as The Big One. Collage made by Andy Smith.

The image shows a computer screen displaying a webpage with a protest message against the killing of black individuals and an attack on nature, indicating a planned rally at parliament on 21 april 2023.
Visual identity and social media content for the activist group Fashion Act Now pressuring the fashion industry to act on the climate and ecological crisis.

The image displays a bold statement that reads "fashion act now" set against a vibrant orange background, where "fashion" is on top and "act now" below it. the font is heavy and impactful, and there is a small skull and crossbones symbol replacing the letter 'o' in "fashion," suggesting a possibly urgent or critical stance on fashion, potentially related to ethical, environmental, or social issues within the industry.
The Save Lewisham Hospital campaign mobilised over 10% of the population of Lewisham in just 3 months, over 2 demonstrations and many outreach events.
People march through a residential street with placards saying save lewisham A&E

Co-design and development of the website and publication platform for Culture Hack Labs, a collective of narrative researchers who support activist groups and others with strategic narrative interventions.
Poster for Scottish civil disobedience group This Is Rigged who are focusing on the climate and cost of living crisis.

A torn protest poster on a wall with a qr code and the slogans "your liberties, your rights were won by suffragettes, by the once rad. fight for what is right now. no new oil and gas. fair transition now." and the website "thisisrigged.org".

Posters and social media content for COP26 in Glasgow 2021. Since then COP has continued to welcome oil & gas lobbyists – poster remains true, and the call for greenwash to get tae fuck (a local Glaswegian phrase) still stands.

Co-founding and curation of a project that gained global and cultural press attention for opposition to the world’s largest arms fair. We also raised the single biggest donation for Campaign Against the Arms Trade by auctioning the art including an original Banksy, a print by Darren Cullen, and a painting by Daisy Parris.
a logo reads Art the Arms Fair

Together with In the shade of a tree and Jérôme Rigaud, we collaborated on a new identity and website for Villa Arson, a national school of fine arts and contemporary arts center in Nice, France. We continue to develop digital projects for the Villa.

Pamphlet on how to plan effective non violent direct action for Extinction Rebellion in 2019. The writing is based on the longer research and writing used to create XR’s first how-to entitled “art, actions logistics” – a Google doc that led the production of thousands of protests in the decentralised climate movement since it was released in late 2018.
How to block a road: guide to direct action

A book cover titled "the how-to guide to planning effective nvda (nonviolent direct action)" with a bright green background, adorned with illustrations of foliages and insects in pink and white, featuring bold typography and an emblem of a circled a, often associated with anarchy, at the bottom center.
An archive website developed for Anna Hart (AiR) with creative direction by Sam Blunden.
A group of schoolgirls expressing surprise and excitement, with mouths wide open, likely watching an event or performance.

In 2021 groups of women smashed the windows of some of the biggest banks funding fossil fuels in the UK including Barclays, HSBC, and JP Morgan. We designed these stickers and patches for the women breaking windows. Since then many of the women have been found not guilty by juries who believed their actions were justified in the face of banks and government inaction in a climate emergency.
Better broken windows than broken promises

We developed this website for the art & industry triennial in Dunkirk 2023 after being selected to produce something that responded to the theme of the art festival “to observe and understand energy activities and environmental upheaval, and the way in which they affect art”. By allowing the viewer to toggle between high and low definition images, and light and dark, the work made the audience aware of the physical impact on energy consumption and the climate our digital lives have. Designed with In the shade of a tree
Human Heat: Website for art triennial

Set of 8 postcards made for the Impossible Rebellion 2021. These were handed out so rebels could write to their friends or to their MP and tell them to join us. “From sunny ice caps, burning forests, flooded streets and the ongoing Rebellion, wish you were here…” Concept and art direction by us, with artworks by Fraser Muggeridge, Fanny Wickström, Miles Glyn, Dan Wilson, AJ Higgins, Minna Sackaria and Thomas Hedger.
Conceptual illustration of a hand gripping a burning earth against a purple background, symbolizing the urgent call to action on climate change by extinction rebellion.
Screen-printed Christmas cards made for Extinction Rebellion in 2019. Collaboration with Hex Prints
A climate change awareness poster with a twist on a classic song title: "baby, it's warm outside" by extinction rebellion.
Digital content and memes to support the activist group Just Stop Oil.
Time to get to work graphics
An illustration featuring a stylized high viz vest with a skull icon, accompanied by an energetic call to action: "time to get to work!" against a black background.
We produce reactive and proactive digital content for campaigners. We also make memes about things that make us mad and things we love.
Sycamore gap chainsaw massacre meme dump

Two overlapping circles creating a venn diagram with text annotations linking rishi sunak and the felling of the sycamore gap tree to a shared central theme of 'unhinged contempt for the natural world'.
Meme dump. We produce reactive and proactive digital content for campaigners. We also make memes about things that make us mad and things we love.
Small dick energy project meme dump

A stylized allegorical representation using a classic painting, where various elements are labeled to depict the struggle of pushing climate justice against the opposing forces of fossil fuel interests, with an implication of political and social dynamics at play.
Banners created in the XR Art Factory for the Rebellion in September 2020. Photography by Immo Klink
Preparing for a protest: colorful banners with bold messages ready to make a statement.
A selection of banners designed for the Rebellion in September 2020.
Protesters holding a banner with explicit language expressing frustration, in front of a gated building, as police officers observe.
Flyposting campaign in London as the city was coming out of the first lockdown in 2020. Made in collaboration with Paris 68 Redux. Photography by Lewis Ronald.

Micro pamphlet flyer for Extinction Rebellion UK laying out what a Citizen’s Assembly is and why they are demanding one. Produced in collaboration with experts in deliberative democracy including Jamie Kelsey Fry including illustrations by Fanny Wickström.

A colorful poster promoting the effectiveness of citizens assemblies, emphasizing inclusivity and fairness in decision-making processes, inviting people to discover more about their function and benefits.
Design of the novel Even the Dead Rise Up by Francis McKee. Published by Book Works (London) 2017.
Even the Dead Rise Up book design
A bright red book cover with blue embossed illustrations and text, titled "francis mckee - even the dead rise up".

Visual identity including a van for the Freedom Tour – a grassroots experiment in direct democracy in summer 2021. The van allowed a group of organisers to tour towns in the UK holding “crisis talks” in parks where people listened to each to find out: what’s next?
A blue truck parked outdoors with the phrase "what's next?" written in large pink letters on its side.

Two colour screen print made in collaboration with Hex Prints, 2023, edition of 15. Submitted to the art auction You might find yourself… to raise money for Just Stop Oil. Get in touch if you’d like to donate to Just Stop Oil in return for a print.
In bed with big oil edition

Artistic black and white photo featuring a close-up of a mouth slightly open, with colored candy tablets resting on the tongue, each inscribed with a different word, in a critique or commentary on topics or personalities.
